bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Davies was an alum of Southern Connecticut State University, class of 1948. She was a collector of Napoleonica and passed away in 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection is divided into two parts: Items 1-5, Statues, Medals and Stamps; and items 6-35, prints.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The itesm are grouped into 2 series:

did.unittitle: Statues, Medals and Stamps
White marble statue of standing Napoleon, 15" high.
Bronze statue of Napoleon standing on black marble base, 8 ½" high, sword broken.
Bronze-colored white metal busts of Napoleon I & Napoleon III, possibly book ends, about 5 ¼" high.
Frame with 7 Liberian stamps featuring Napoleon, as well as two small medals of the same.
Frame with 16 Liberian stamps featuring Napoleon.
Prints
Two framed prints for exhibit Napoleon in English Caricature at the Huntington Library, California 1974/5. About 16" x 20".
Framed print entitled Levée du siège de Mantoue. An incident in the campaign of 1796 during the French revolutionary wars. About 13" x 10 ½".
Framed print entitled Le passage du Saint Bernard. Chromolithograph depicting the forcing of the St. Bernard Pass prior to the Battle of Marengo, 1800. About 9" x 11 ¾"

Framed print entitled Las Casas and His Son Writing the History of Napoleon under his Dictation. "Aquarelle made for the Century Co." "From the Aquarelle by F. De Myrbach." "Typogravure Boussard, Valadon & Co., Paris." Depiction of Emmanuel Las Cases taking dictation from Napoleon on St. Helena where he wrote Mémorial de Sainte-Hélène [1823]. Interesting example of aquatint process. Print has been damaged by poor mounting.
Framed photograph of section of larger painting. Inscription at bottom obscure, but "Musee de Versailles…….Ier a………..Gosse. X. Phot." About 7" x 4 5/8".
Framed photograph of section of larger painting of defeated Napoleon. "Photogravure Goupil & Co." About 6 ½" x 4 ¾".

Framed portrait of Napoleon on green ground with wreath of olive branches superimposed by crown. In left corner "Frederic Masson de l'academie franciase," in center "Napoleon" while in lower right "Illustrations de F. Myrbach." Possibly the cover of a portfolio collection. About 8 ½" x 11".
Framed portrait of Napoleon, " Lith & Pub by N. Currier 2 Spruce St. NY" At this address from 1838 to 1856. Hand-colored lithograph. About 13" x 17 ¾".

Framed print of Napoleon and others, The Abdication, Fontainebleau, April 6, 1814:00:00 From the Painting of Etienne Prosper Berne-Bellecour, "typogravure Boussod, Valadon & Co., Paris." About 7 ¼" x 9 ¼".
Framed portrait of Napoleon, Napoleon in 1813 From the painting by Amable-Claude Pagnest…engraved by T. Johnson. About 7" x 9".
Framed print of Napoleon and others, The Abdication, Fontainbleau, April 6, 1814 From the painting of Etienne Prosper Berne-Bellecour….typogravure Doussod, Valadon & Co., Paris. About 9 ¼" x 8 ¼".

Framed print of Napoleon and others, The Surrender of Buonaparte on board the Bellerophon. "G. M. Brighty del [drawn]…….Pubd by T. Kinnersley June 1. 1816…..G. P. Palmer Sculp [engraved]." About 10" x 7 ½".

Framed portrait of Napoleon standing, camp in background. Napoleon Bonaparte. Quote: "Who born no King, .made Monarchs draw his car….Byron." "No. 64…..H. Dawe scupt.[engraved]" Aquatint? About 9 ¼" x 7 ¼".
Small portrait of Napoleon, apparently cut out of a promotional brochure for a print of the Battle of Wagram (1809). About 2 ¾" x 5".
Framed portrait of Napoleon in oval cartouche, 4 ¾" x 6 5/8", below: NAPOLEON BONAPARTE LIEUTENANT Colonel Ier. BON DE LA CORSE en 1792 NAPOLEON Ier. EMPEREUR DES FRANCAIS 1804.
Framed portrait of Napoleon in oval 6 3/8" apparently a photolithograph of a painting, possibly cut from a magazine.
Framed portrait of Napoleon in oval 9 ½" apparently a photolithograph of a painting, possibly from a book.
Framed portrait of Napoleon 4 7/16" x 6 3/8" apparently a photolithograph of a painting.
Framed portrait of Napoleon 7 ½" x 9 ¼" apparently a lithograph of an engraving, Napoleon Bonaparte Lieutenant-Colonel of the First Battalion of Corsica from the painting by H. E. F Philippoteaux.
Framed colored portrait of Napoleon standing in front of desk , tall case clock in background, 6" x 9 1/8". Photolithograph cut from some other source.
Framed colored portrait of Napoleon on deathbed with olive crown, 7 ½" x 9 ½".
Framed colored portrait of Napoleon standing, church in background, 7 7/8" x 11 3/8". Photolithograph of painting, cut from some large work.
Framed colored (blue and gold) portrait of Napoleon on horseback 15 ½" x 23", NAPOLEON. And "Propriete de l'Editeur. (Dépose)," and "A Epinal, chez PELLERION, Imprimeur-Libraire."
Large framed portrait of Napoleon, 17" x 21".
Unmounted poster for world premier of opera Napoleon by Robert Beadell (1924-1995), 22" x 25 ½" in Kimball Hall, venue uncertain.
Framed color portrait of Napoleon, 8 ½" x 11 ¼".

Framed colored acquaint, portrait of Napoleon in oval, Bonaparte Premier Consul de la Republique Francais below scene of military revue in the Place du Caroussel, "Revue du Quintidi a Paris, chez Xubev Editeur Rue 2 St. Lazare Chausseé de Aulin No. 88," ""Déposé a la Bibliotheque Nle le 1 of Messidor, Year X [1801]. At left: "Boilly Penxil," at center: "Duplessia Bevtaux aqua forti," at right "Levachez Sculpt."
Framed engraving of retreat from Moscow, 1814. About 17 ¼ x 24" from the painting (1864) by Jean-Louise-Ernest Meissonier (1815-1891), engraved by Jules Jacquet, printed by A. Solomon, Paris.
Framed colored portrait of a young Napoleon 13 "x 17". Elaborate frame much damaged from move.

Pair of dismounted colored engravings about 10" x 9" entitled ON NE PASSE PAS and APRES VOUS SIRE concerning the life of Napoleon. "à Paris chez Desmaisons, rue Guenegaud. 14. Dauty Palais Royal Galerie de Namours." Both damaged by poor mounting adhesive.
